weeks_later.speaker: Narrator
weeks_later.text: The cafe has become their meeting ground. Every few days, Elena and Thomas sit together. Sometimes they talk. Sometimes they sit in comfortable silence. Today, something feels different.

elena_arrives.speaker: Narrator
elena_arrives.text: Elena arrives carrying a small, worn box. She sets it on the table with trembling hands, waiting for Thomas.

thomas_arrives.speaker: Thomas
thomas_arrives.text: *He slides into his seat, notices the box* What's this?

elena_explains.speaker: Elena
elena_explains.text: I've been holding onto this for five years. Carrying it from apartment to apartment like some kind of... punishment. I think it's time.

elena_opens.speaker: Narrator
elena_opens.text: She opens the box. Inside are photographs, old letters, small treasures from their childhood. A family preserved in paper and memories.

thomas_emotional.speaker: Thomas
thomas_emotional.text: *His breath catches* Is that... the picture from when we built the treehouse?

elena_confirms.speaker: Elena
elena_confirms.text: *Nodding* And Mother's recipe cards. And the letter Father wrote us when we graduated. And... *she pulls out two small stones* The wishing stones from the river.

thomas_remembers.speaker: Thomas
thomas_remembers.text: *His eyes fill with tears* I thought these were lost forever. I thought... I thought I'd lost everything.

elena_gift.speaker: Elena
elena_gift.text: *She pushes one of the stones toward him* I've been the keeper of our family's memories for too long. Holding them like weapons instead of treasures. *Her voice shakes* I want you to have half.

thomas_overwhelmed.speaker: Thomas
thomas_overwhelmed.text: *He picks up the stone, clutching it like something precious* Elena... I don't deserve this.

elena_truth.speaker: Elena
elena_truth.text: Maybe not. But I'm tired of keeping score. *She takes a deep breath* I forgive you, Thomas.

elena_repeats.speaker: Elena
elena_repeats.text: I forgive you. *Tears stream down her face* Not because you earned it. Not because the past doesn't matter. But because I want my brother back more than I want to be right.

thomas_breaks.speaker: Thomas
thomas_breaks.text: *He breaks down completely* I'm so sorry. I'm so sorry. I'll spend every day proving you made the right choice. I promise, Elena. I promise.

elena_reaches.speaker: Narrator
elena_reaches.text: For the first time in five years, Elena reaches across the table and takes her brother's hand.

elena_final.speaker: Elena
elena_final.text: *Through tears, but smiling* We've got a lot of lost time to make up for, little brother. Think you can handle having an overprotective big sister again?

thomas_laughs.speaker: Thomas
thomas_laughs.text: *Half-laughing, half-crying* I wouldn't have it any other way.

player_gift.speaker: Elena
player_gift.text: *She turns to you, composing herself* We have something for you. For giving us a place to find each other again.

thomas_recipe.speaker: Thomas
thomas_recipe.text: *He produces a worn piece of paper* Our mother's recipes. She used to say food brings families together. *He and Elena share a look* We want you to have them. All of them.

dragon_celebrates.speaker: Narrator
dragon_celebrates.text: Your dragon practically dances with joy, moving between the siblings as they embrace for the first time in five years. Some wounds never fully heal - but sometimes, they can become scars that remind us how strong love really is.
